App-V 4.x FAQs

 

App-V 4.x FAQs is series of articles on Microsoft App-V 4.5/4.6 articles to address common questions for those new to App-V:

  1. What is Application Virtualization?
  2. What is Microsoft Application Virtualization
  3. How is App-V licensed?
  4. Where can I download App-V?
  5. What are the current versions of App-V?
  6. What are the system requirements for App-V?
  7. Is App-V an Application Compatibility solution?
  8. Can I use Application Compatibility Shims with App-V?
  9. Can App-V be used to run 16-bit applications on Windows x64?
  10. Does App-V allow me to run applications on Linux or Mac OS X?
  11. What are the dependencies of the App-V Client?
  12. How do I create a silent installation for the App-V Client?
  13. How do I configure the App-V Client in stand-alone mode?
  14. Can I configure the App-V Client via Group Policy?
  15. Where do I go to find out how the App-V Client works?
  16. Where can I find information on sequencing applications?
  17. Can I run an application on Win7 that was sequenced on WinXP?
  18. Can I virtualise Internet Explorer with App-V?
  19. Does App-V replace Citrix XenApp or Remote Desktop Services?
  20. What are the deployment methods for App-V?
  21. Does the delivery method change how applications are sequenced?
  22. Do I need to backup the App-V Management Server?
  23. How do I troubleshoot the App-V Management Server?
  24. Can I use Active Upgrade without RTSP(S)?
  25. What tools does Microsoft provide for App-V?
  26. What 3rd party tools are there for managing App-V?
  27. How do I get an application into the App-V bubble for troubleshooting?
  28. How do I restrict access to specific applications in an App-V package?
  29. How do I configure my App-V clients to stream from a local source?
  30. My virtual application won’t start. Where do I start troubleshooting?
  31. Can I virtualize the .NET Framework or Visual C++ Redistributables?
  32. What are Providers Policies?
